string-array.item: Just trying it out / just started

resources.string:
Upon launching the app, you'll find yourself on the Record screen.

 Confirm the iPhone has a good fix on your location by checking the map before tapping Start. (GPS conditions sometimes prevent accurate location. If this is the case, cycle a short distance and check again.) 

When you're ready to start recording your ride, tap Start.

When your ride is over, tap Save. Confirm that your trip is done by tapping Save in the next pop-up. If you don\'t want to save the trip and upload the data - for whatever reason - simply choose Discard. If you tap Save by accident and want to continue recording your current trip, choose Continue.\n\nIf you have switched to another app while recording your ride, you can get back to Fountain City Cycling by selecting it from your Home Screen or from the App Switcher. If your battery goes below a 20% charge, Fountain City Cycling will automatically stop recording and shut down.

Select a purpose on the Trip Purpose screen and tap Save. We\'re interested in the MAIN purpose for each trip you make. If you\'re unsure how to categorize a trip, select Other from the Trip Purpose chooser. You can always include a comment before transmitting.\n\nFountain City Cycling will prompt you to enter comments or notes on the ride, which you can skip if you have none. It will then upload your ride data, notifying you when done. If there\'s a problem connecting to the server, it will prompt you to retry at another time.

After your data is uploaded, Fountain City Cycling displays the map of your ride, showing the route, distance travelled, and average speed.\n\nTap My Trips on the tab-bar at the bottom of the screen to show a list of all your rides, including dates, times, mileage, CO2 saved, and calories burned. Tap on a trip to display its map. Share the map with others by taking a screenshot (press Sleep/wake and Home simultaneously), and sending it via email or downloading it to your computer. Hint: you can zoom in or out on the map. Tap Edit on the trip list to delete a trip.

Do you know of an asset that will help other cyclists along your route - such as good bike parking, a water fountain, or a secret passage to cut through? Or have you noticed an issue you\'d like to see addressed - such as a traffic signal that won\'t change or a problem with a bike lane? Tap on Note this and choose the issue or assets from the pop-up and then tap Save. \n\nIf none of the options fit your observation, choose Note this asset or Note this issue and you can fill in additional details on the next screen. Tap Save on the Detail screen to upload your issue or asset.

You can add an optional photo or additional details for each issue and asset, or skip either one and just tap Save to upload your note.\n\nTap Add photo to open the camera and take a photo of the issue or asset. You can then preview your photo, and either tap Use, or Retake if you want to take it again. Type any optional notes in the Additional Details box.

Tap My Notes on the tab-bar at the bottom of the screen to show a list of all your assets (in blue) and issues (in red), with dates and times.\n\nTap on a note to display its map. You can then tap the i for Info to see the picture and additional details, if any, that you entered for this note. Tap Edit on the top of the My Notes page to delete a note.

Entering personal info is completely optional and confidential, and, if you choose to participate, only has to be done once. It involves a few basic questions useful to our study. If you wish to give us your email address, the City of Columbus may contact you directly about your experience using Fountain City Cycling or bicycling in the city. Tap Save when finished.\n\nThis Help menu is available from Getting started with Fountain City Cycling.

For your own safety, please do not listen to music with your headphones, talk on the phone, or look at the screen while cycling. Please pull over before reporting an asset or issue on your trip.\n\nBe sure to enable Location in your phone\'s Settings. (From the Home page, go to Settings, then Location Services.)
